ejb

Class LocationSSB

  • java.lang.Object
    • ejb.LocationSSB

  • public class LocationSSB
extends java.lang.Object
    The LocationSSB provides access to the location database entries, all code in the rest of the project accesses location data in the database through this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocationSSB() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addCheckIn(Location location)
      This method add a check-in to the database, the username is a field in the location object that is passed to it, a check-in is the same as a location except for the boolean field in the location object called check-in is set to true.
      boolean addLocation(Location location)
      This allows us to add a location to the location table in the database.
      java.util.List<Location> getAllCheckIns()
      This method provides a list of all the check-ins (locations) stored in the database, only used for testing.
      java.util.List<Location> getAllLocations()
      This method provides a list of all the locations stored in the database, only used for testing.
      java.util.List<Location> getUserCheckIns(java.lang.String username)
      this method returns all the check-ins of a specific user where the username of that user is passed as a parameter, a check-in is the same as a location object except for the boolean field in the location object called check-in is set to true.
      java.util.List<Location> getUserLocations(java.lang.String username)
      This will return all the locations for as specific user, where the user's username is passed as a parameter.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • LocationSSB

        public LocationSSB()

    • Method Detail

      • addLocation

        public boolean addLocation(Location location)
        This allows us to add a location to the location table in the database. it takes a location object and stores it in the database
        Parameters:
        location - this is our location to be stored in the database
        Returns:
        true if the location has successfully be stored.

      • getUserLocations

        public java.util.List<Location> getUserLocations(java.lang.String username)
        This will return all the locations for as specific user, where the user's username is passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user we want to get the locations of.
        Returns:
        List of locations for the specific user, specified by the username parameter..

      • getAllLocations

        public java.util.List<Location> getAllLocations()
        This method provides a list of all the locations stored in the database, only used for testing.
        Returns:
        list of all locations in the database.

      • addCheckIn

        public boolean addCheckIn(Location location)
        This method add a check-in to the database, the username is a field in the location object that is passed to it, a check-in is the same as a location except for the boolean field in the location object called check-in is set to true.
        Parameters:
        location - the check-in (location that we want to store
        Returns:
        true if the check-in (location) is stored.

      • getUserCheckIns

        public java.util.List<Location> getUserCheckIns(java.lang.String username)
        this method returns all the check-ins of a specific user where the username of that user is passed as a parameter, a check-in is the same as a location object except for the boolean field in the location object called check-in is set to true.
        Parameters:
        username - of the user we want to get the check-ins for.
        Returns:
        list of check-ins (locations) for the specific user.

      • getAllCheckIns

        public java.util.List<Location> getAllCheckIns()
        This method provides a list of all the check-ins (locations) stored in the database, only used for testing.
        Returns:
        list of all check-ins (locations) in the database.
